channel.title: Comments on: Why Opera 9.5 still isn’t my default browser

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description: David -- thanks for the explanation. I experiment with every version of Opera as it comes out, but usually some of my favorite sites (or needed sites) don't work, so I abandon it (as I'd rather not have multiple browser applications open unless absolutely necessary). :)
item.content:encoded: David — thanks for the explanation. I experiment with every version of Opera as it comes out, but usually some of my favorite sites (or needed sites) don’t work, so I abandon it (as I’d rather not have multiple browser applications open unless absolutely necessary). :)

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description: Jon -- try going to that page and navigating around the content for PowerShell. You can't. It doesn't work (the drop down's don't work and with the tree not in the right place, I can't get to the other Powershell related content).
item.content:encoded: Jon — try going to that page and navigating around the content for PowerShell. You can’t. It doesn’t work (the drop down’s don’t work and with the tree not in the right place, I can’t get to the other Powershell related content).

item.title: By: jon
item.dc:creator: jon
item.description:
wow, what a terrible reason to not use opera. who goes to msdn to browse the tree anyway?
seriously, i've been using opera for the last year and the main reason i use it is because it is soo much snappier and faster than any other browser on the market (yes, even ff3). once you use opera for a significant period of time, anything else feels significantly more sluggish.
item.content:encoded:
wow, what a terrible reason to not use opera. who goes to msdn to browse the tree anyway?

seriously, i’ve been using opera for the last year and the main reason i use it is because it is soo much snappier and faster than any other browser on the market (yes, even ff3). once you use opera for a significant period of time, anything else feels significantly more sluggish.

item.title: By: david storey
item.dc:creator: david storey
item.description: It isn't open due to browser sniffing, where MS detect Opera and send up broken code. We've reported it to MS but they've never fixed it.
item.content:encoded: It isn’t open due to browser sniffing, where MS detect Opera and send up broken code. We’ve reported it to MS but they’ve never fixed it.
